column2: DELAWARE PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Delaware
column6: DE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column6: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 3. Which of the following is true about large trucks?
column4: Large trucks can lose speed on long or steep uphill climbs.
column6: It takes longer for large trucks to get up to speed when they enter traffic.
column8: The other answers are both correct.

column2: 4. When entering a freeway, you should check traffic by:
column4: using the inside mirror.
column6: using both the inside and outside mirrors.
column8: using the side mirror and looking over your shoulder.

column2: 5. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 6. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column6: If it's been raining several hours.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.

column2: 7. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the right lane ends.
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 8. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column6: All of the above.

column2: 9. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: stay within that speed range.
column6: drive a few MPH slower than most.
column8: drive a few MPH faster than most.

column2: 10. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: avoid drinking coffee.
column6: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 11. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: at most intersections.
column6: on multiple lane highways.

column2: 12. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.
column6: Marijuana.

column2: 13. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column8: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.

column2: 14. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 15. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: after it has been raining for at least two hours.
column6: during the first half hour of rain.
column8: when it's been raining all day.

column2: 16. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.
column6: slow down.

column2: 17. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 18. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
column4: on long trips.
column6: at all times.

column2: 19. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians when:
column4: pedestrians are crossing the road in marked crosswalks.
column6: All of the above.
column8: the driver is turning a corner and pedestrians are crossing with the light.

column2: 20. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: indicate no pass zones.
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column4: Warning: U-turn ahead.
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 22. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column8: the speed limit on that route.

column2: 23. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column4: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column6: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.

column2: 24. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 25. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: check your blind spots and, mirrors.
column6: signal your intention before changing lanes.

column2: 26. To avoid panic stops, you should:
column4: pump your brakes to make sure they work.
column6: drive with your window down.
column8: scan the road ahead for hazards.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road
column6: Slippery when wet

column2: 28. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
column4: improves traffic flow.
column6: helps prevent rear-end collisions.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 30. Driving at excessive speed:
column4: improves your reaction time.
column6: does not increase the chance of a crash.
